where q
i, s ( t) is the individual’s susceptibility, and I other, s ( t) is an indicator variable that equals 1 if any other household member is infected with subtype s at time t and 0 if not. Because we do not track households in their entirety (we sample only individuals that were not vaccinated during the study), we do not model density-dependent within-household transmission. Rather, ω
s describes the daily influenza exposure rate that individual i experiences with the presence of any infected family member.
